briefdescription.para: This function is used to enable a shield sensor for acquisition by a given ADC.

simplesect.para: This function requires the presence of an "shielde-sensor" node in the shield device-tree.
This function must be called before ADC is started.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the sensor using enumeration sensor_t.
The ADC which should be used for acquisition.

simplesect.para: 0 if the sensor was correctly enabled, negative value if there was an error.

briefdescription.para: Function to access the acquired data for specified sensor. This function provides a buffer in which all data that have been acquired since last call are stored. The count of these values is returned as an output parameter: the user has to define a variable and pass it as the parameter of the function. The variable will be updated with the number of values that are available in the buffer.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled and the DataAPI module is started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.
When calling this function, it invalidates the buffer returned by a previous call to the same function. However, different sensors buffers are independent from each other.
When using this functions, the user is responsible for data conversion. Use matching spin.data.convert*() function for this purpose.
When using this function, DO NOT use the function to get the latest converted value for the same sensor as this function will clear the buffer and disregard all values but the latest.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor from which to obtain values.
Pass an uint32_t variable. This variable will be updated with the number of values that are present in the returned buffer.

simplesect.para: Pointer to a buffer in which the acquired values are stored. If number_of_values_acquired is 0, do not try to access the buffer as it may be nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Function to access the acquired data for specified pin. This function converts all values that have been acquired since last call are stored and provide an array containing all of them. The count of these values is returned as an output parameter: the user has to define a variable and pass it as the parameter of the function. The variable will be updated with the number of values that are available in the buffer.

simplesect.para: This is an expensive function. Calling this function trigger the conversion of all values acquired since the last call. If only the lastet value is required, it is advised to call getLatestValue() instead. If multiple values are required, but not all, it is advised to call getRawValues() instead, then explicitely convert required values using convertValue().
This function can't be called before the pin is enabled. The DataAPI module must have been started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.
When calling this function, it invalidates the array returned by a previous call to the same function. However, different channels buffers are independent from each other.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor from which to obtain values.
Pass an uint32_t variable. This variable will be updated with the number of values that are present in the returned buffer.

simplesect.para: Pointer to an array in which the acquired values are stored. If number_of_values_acquired is 0, do not try to access the buffer as it may be nullptr.

briefdescription.para: Function to access the latest value available from the sensor, expressed in the relevant unit for the data: Volts, Amperes, or Degree Celcius. This function will not touch anything in the buffer, and thus can be called safely at any time after the module has been started.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled and the DataAPI module is started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor from which to obtain value.

simplesect.para: Latest available value available from the given sensor. If there was no value acquired by this sensor yet, return value is NO_VALUE.

briefdescription.para: This function returns the latest acquired measure expressed in the relevant unit for the sensor: Volts, Amperes, or Degree Celcius.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled and the DataAPI module is started, either explicitly or by starting the Uninterruptible task.
When using this functions, you loose the ability to access raw values using spin.data.get*RawValues() function for the matching sensor, as spin.data.get*() function clears the buffer on each call.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor from which to obtain value.

Pointer to an uint8_t variable. This parameter is facultative. If this parameter is provided, it will be updated to indicate information about spin.data. Possible values for this parameter will be:
DATA_IS_OK if returned data is a newly acquired data,
DATA_IS_OLD if returned data has already been provided before (no new data available since latest time this function was called),
DATA_IS_MISSING if returned data is NO_VALUE.

simplesect.para: Latest measure acquired by the sensor. If no value was acquired by this sensor yet, return value is NO_VALUE.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to convert values obtained using matching spin.data.get*RawValues() function to relevant unit for the data: Volts, Amperes, or Degree Celcius.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor from which the value originates
Raw value obtained from which the value originates

simplesect.para: Converted value in the relevant unit. Returns ERROR_CHANNEL_NOT_FOUND if the sensor is not active.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to tweak the conversion values for any linear sensor if default values are not accurate enough.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled. The DataAPI must not have been started, neither explicitly nor by starting the Uninterruptible task.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor to set conversion values.
Gain to be applied (multiplied) to the sensor raw value.
Offset to be applied (added) to the sensor value after gain has been applied.

memberdef.argsstring: (sensor_t sensor_name, float32_t r0, float32_t b, float32_t rdiv, float32_t t0)
memberdef.name: setConversionParametersNtcThermistor

briefdescription.para: Use this function to set the conversion values for any NTC thermistor sensor if default values are not accurate enough.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled. The DataAPI must not have been started, neither explicitly nor by starting the Uninterruptible task.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor to set conversion values.
The NTC resistance at a reference temperature.
The sensibility coefficient of the resistance to temperature.
The bridge dividor resistance used to condition the NTC.
The reference temperature of the thermistor.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to get the current conversion parameteres for the chosen sensor.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor to get a conversion parameter.
Paramater to be retreived: gain or offset.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to get the current conversion type for the chosen sensor.

simplesect.para: This function can't be called before the sensor is enabled.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor to get a conversion parameter.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to write the gain and offset parameters of the board to is non-volatile memory.

simplesect.para: This function should be called after updating the parameters using setParameters.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor to save the values.

briefdescription.para: Use this function to read the gain and offset parameters of the board to is non-volatile memory.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the shield sensor to save the values.

simplesect.para: 0 if parameters were correcly retreived, negative value if there was an error: -1: NVS is empty -2: NVS contains data, but their version doesn't match current version -3: NVS data is corrupted -4: NVS contains data, but not for the requested channel

briefdescription.para: This function is used to enable acquisition of all voltage/current sensors on the Twist shield. Sensors are attributed as follows: ADC1: - V1, V2, V3, VH, VN ADC2: - I1, I2, I3, IH, T.

simplesect.para: This function will configure ADC 1 and 2 to be automatically triggered by the HRTIM, so the board must be configured as a power converted to enable HRTIM events. All other ADCs remain software triggered, thus will only be acquired when triggerAcquisition() is called. It also configures the gpios that control the MUX that chooses which temperature will be measured.
This function must be called before ADC is started.

briefdescription.para: This function sets the gpios attached to the MUX to control which measurement will be performed. The logic is: IN1 IN2 TEMP 1 T F TEMP 2 F T TEMP 3 T T.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the temperature sensor to trigger. Can be either TEMP_1, TEMP_2 or TEMP_3.

simplesect.para: This function will decide which value will be read automatically by the ADC2 to which the temperature of the Ownverter is linked.

briefdescription.para: This function is used to enable acquisition of all voltage/current sensors on the Twist shield. Sensors are attributed as follows: ADC1: - I1_LOW ADC2: - I2_LOW.

simplesect.para: This function will configure ADC 1 and 2 to be automatically triggered by the HRTIM, so the board must be configured as a power converted to enable HRTIM events. All other ADCs remain software triggered, thus will only be acquired when triggerAcquisition() is called.
This function must be called before ADC is started.

briefdescription.para: Manually set parameters values using console. You will be directed via console to input the parameters of each sensor of the Twist board. After the parameters have been inputed, they will be stored in Spin Non-Volatile memory so that they are automatically applied on subsequent boots.

simplesect.para: This function requires a console to interact with the user. The board must be connected to a computer using USB to display the console.

This function can't be called before all Twist sensors have been enabled (you can use enableDefaultTwistSensors() for that purpose). The DataAPI must not have been started, neither explicitly nor by starting the Uninterruptible task.

briefdescription.para: Manually triggers the temperature measurement of the Twist board.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the temperature sensor to trigger. Can be either TEMP_SENSOR_1 or TEMP_SENSOR_2.

simplesect.para: This function must be called to trigger a conversion of the ADC to which the sensor is linked. It must be called BEFORE reading a new measurement. Account for delays in the measurement.

briefdescription.para: This function returns a structure containing information about an enabled sensor from a sensor name.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the sensor as defined in the device tree.

simplesect.para: Structure containing the ADC number, channel number and pin number for the given sensor name, or (0, 0, 0) if sensor name doesn't exist or hasn't been configured.

briefdescription.para: Builds the list of device-tree defined sensors for each ADC.
Function to retraive a line from console.
Function to ask user about a coefficient.
